td.content: s:patient presents with critical cough, critical dyspnea, Respiratory. he has history of critical shortness of breath. patient is a 44 yr old male butcher. he has been a chronic smoker for the last 2 years he denies drinking alcohol o:Height 71 in, Weight 143 lbs, Temperature 98.6 F, Pulse 78, SystolicBP 108, DiastolicBP 68, Respiration 16, FEV1 FEV1=35 %, FEV1/FVC FEV1/FVC=60 %, Arterial Blood Gas PaCO2=44 mmHg,PaO2=58 mmHg, plum: accessory muscle use, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, HEENT: WNL, rales Bil a:Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease p:administered OMS - 50 DEMAND OXYGEN via nasal cannula (contin), performed FEV1, FEV1/FVC, Arterial Blood Gas, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.

Term.SOAP_SECTION: head, eyes, ears, nose, throat Examination

td.content: s:pt presents with 5 days history of mild sad mood. pt also reports mild feelings of unattractiveness, feeling betrayed and foolish. he is a 44 yo male. Patient reports that he never drinks alcohol pt has a one pack per day habit o:Height 71 in, Weight 145 lbs, Temperature 98.7 F, Pulse 78, SystolicBP 110, DiastolicBP 71, Respiration 17 a:Depression p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed citalopram - 20 mg /day, and ordered Mental Status exam.
